title: The Story of a Ticket Trickster
summary: Miles Hart was a man who tricked his friends and others by selling fake tickets to the Glastonbury music festival. He told people he could get them special passes because his family owned land near the festival or worked with companies there. Many believed him and paid a lot of money, but the tickets were never real. Miles made up false invoices and emails to fool everyone. When the festival came, he disappeared, leaving people angry and in debt. The BBC talked to his old friends to learn how he did this bad thing. It shows that lying can hurt many people and it's important to be honest.

background_read: Glastonbury Festival is a famous music event in England that many people want to attend. Tickets sell out very fast, so some people try to buy them from others. A scammer is someone who lies to take money from people. In this story, Miles Hart pretended to sell tickets but they were fake, which hurt his friends and others. It's important to only buy tickets from official sellers to avoid being tricked.
